required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Synaquell on Brain Function
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Synaquell on Objective Brain Function Measures in Ice Hockey Players

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the dietary supplement, Synaquell (TM), for effects on brain function.

detailed_description.textblock: Ice Hockey players will be administered Synaquell over the course of one season. Each player will be administered Synaquell or a placebo twice, daily. They will be tested during the preseason and the postseason to compare changes in cognitive measures. This is an optimal population, as Synaquell was designed for contact sport athletes and others sustaining frequent head impacts.

primary_outcome.description: Obtained by EEG recording of N100, P300, N400 amplitudes and latencies. Increased amplitudes are indicative of larger signals and increased latencies are indicative of slower responses.
Neurofilament light chain (NfL) blood serum levels.

secondary_outcome.description: A rapid number-naming test that requires individuals to read 3 numbered cards a loud as fast as possible, the resulting time is the KDT score.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive the dietary supplement, Synaquell, twice-daily during the hockey season.
Subjects will receive the placebo twice-daily, during the hockey season.

intervention.description: 15.8 grams of Synaquell are mixed with 10 ounces of water two times per day and consumed.
15.8 grams of a placebo (that looks, smells, and tastes like Synaquell) are mixed with 10 ounces of water two times per day and consumed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or greater.
- Fluent English speakers.
- Medically cleared to play ice hockey.
Exclusion Criteria:
- An allergy to the ingredients of Synaquell or Synaquell+ (Magnesium, beta hydroxybutyrate, Glutathione, N-acetyl-L-cysteine, Riboflavin, Magnesium, Leucine, Isoleucine, Valine, Resveratrol, Curcumin Phytosome, Nicotinamide riboside, Docosahexanoic Acid).
- Clinically documented hearing issues.
- In-ear hearing aid or cochlear implant.
- Implanted pacemaker or defibrillator.
- Metal or plastic implants in skull.
- Lack of verbal fluency in the English language.
- History of seizures.
- Allergy to rubbing alcohol or EEG gel.
- Unhealthy scalp.
